title: Split validation runner.py into focused modules
description:
## Problem
\`vibe_quant/validation/runner.py\` is 1,206 lines handling multiple concerns:
- Strategy loading and DSL compilation (~150 lines)
- NautilusTrader engine configuration (~200 lines)
- Data preparation and instrument setup (~150 lines)
- Backtest execution orchestration (~200 lines)
- Result extraction from NT engine (~200 lines)
- Trade record building and P&L calculation (~150 lines)
- SQLite result persistence (~150 lines)

## Solution
Split into focused modules within validation/:

1. **vibe_quant/validation/engine.py** (~250 lines)
   - NT BacktestEngine configuration
   - Venue setup (integrates fill_model.py, latency.py)
   - Data loading into engine
   - Engine lifecycle management

2. **vibe_quant/validation/results.py** (~250 lines)
   - Result extraction from NT engine state
   - TradeRecord building
   - P&L calculation
   - Metric aggregation
   - Result persistence to SQLite

3. **vibe_quant/validation/runner.py** (~300-400 lines remaining)
   - High-level orchestration only
   - Calls: load_strategy() → configure_engine() → run() → extract_results()
   - Public API: run_validation(strategy_id, config) → ValidationResult

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] runner.py reduced from 1,206 to <500 lines
- [ ] engine.py handles all NT BacktestEngine setup
- [ ] results.py handles all post-run extraction and persistence
- [ ] Public API unchanged: run_validation() signature stable
- [ ] All validation tests pass
- [ ] No circular imports between validation submodules

title: Visual Condition Builder - row-based entry/exit condition builder with dropdowns
description:
Current: Entry/exit conditions are free-form text areas where users type condition strings like 'rsi_14 < 30'. No autocomplete, no syntax highlighting, errors only at save time.

Problem: This is the single biggest UX gap. Users must memorize condition syntax, indicator names, and operators. Typos aren't caught until validation. Composer and 3Commas solve this with visual builders.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Row-based condition builder with 4 columns:
  - Col 1: Left operand dropdown (defined indicators + close/open/high/low)
  - Col 2: Operator dropdown (<, >, <=, >=, crosses_above, crosses_below, between)
  - Col 3: Right operand (number input or indicator dropdown, contextual)
  - Col 4: [+] Add / [-] Remove buttons
- AND logic between conditions (matching current DSL semantics)
- Each row auto-generates the condition string
- 'Advanced: raw condition' toggle per row for free-text edge cases
- Real-time condition validation with green checkmarks per row
- Toggle between visual builder and raw text mode
- Support for 'between' operator (shows two value inputs)
- Separate builder sections for long entry, short entry, long exit, short exit

title: Extract shared PerformanceMetrics dataclass
description:
## Problem
Screening and validation pipelines define overlapping metric fields independently:
- `screening/pipeline.py` defines `BacktestMetrics` dataclass with: sharpe, sortino, max_drawdown, total_return, profit_factor, win_rate, num_trades, fees, funding
- `validation/runner.py` defines `ValidationResult` dataclass with the same fields plus extras

This duplication causes:
- Inconsistent field names/types between modules
- Dashboard code that must handle both formats
- Risk of metric definition drift

## Solution
Create `vibe_quant/metrics.py` with a shared `PerformanceMetrics` dataclass containing the common fields. Both `BacktestMetrics` and `ValidationResult` should compose or extend this class.

```python
@dataclass
class PerformanceMetrics:
    sharpe_ratio: float
    sortino_ratio: float
    max_drawdown_pct: float
    total_return_pct: float
    profit_factor: float
    win_rate: float
    num_trades: int
    total_fees: float
    total_funding: float
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `vibe_quant/metrics.py` created with `PerformanceMetrics`
- [ ] `screening/pipeline.py` `BacktestMetrics` uses/extends `PerformanceMetrics`
- [ ] `validation/runner.py` `ValidationResult` uses/extends `PerformanceMetrics`
- [ ] Dashboard pages that read metrics work with unified type
- [ ] All existing tests pass

## Files to Modify

- vibe_quant/screening/pipeline.py
- vibe_quant/validation/runner.py
- vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/results_analysis.py (if it accesses metric fields)
